table.name: location
table.description: Location table contains contacts registered by users. This table implement the user location database. It maps UID to a set of contacts registered by the user represented by the UID.

column.name: uid
uuid
column.description: UID (Unique user ID) of the user who owns the contact.

column.name: contact
column.description: The SIP URI from Contact header field of REGISTER message.

column.name: server_id
column.description: The ID of the SIP server instance responsible for the contact.

column.name: received
column.description: URI containing the source IP, source port, destination IP, destination port, and transport protocol of the packet containing the REGISTER request that created the contact. This is mainly used for NAT traversal. The format of this column is sip:<src_ip>:<src_port>;dstip=<dst_ip>;dstport=<dst_port>.

column.name: expires
column.description: Expiry date and time of the contact. In UTC.

column.name: q
column.description: Preference of the contact among all contacts with the same UID. See RFC3261 for more details. The format of this value is floating point number in a range from 0 to 1.0. Value of -1.0 has a special meaning, it means that the user agent provided no q parameter and the proxy server should use implementation specific value.

column.name: callid
column.description: The value of the Call-ID header field from the REGISTER message that created the contact.

column.name: cseq
column.description: CSeq number from the REGISTER message that created the contact.

column.name: flags
column.description: Various flags from the SER configuration script.

column.name: user_agent
column.description: The user agent string from the REGISTER message that created the contact. This is the identification of the user agent that is registering the contact.

column.name: instance
column.description: The value of sip.instance parameter from the REGISTER request.
